paragraphs.text: North Korea: An 'act of war' over a movie?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: At his press conference on Friday, President Barack Obama said that Sony "made a mistake" by not releasing its film "The Interview" on schedule
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He said:"We cannot have a society in which some dictator some place can start imposing censorship here in the United States."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The dictator in question is North Korea's Kim Jung-un
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sony acted following both a major hack of its computer files and, more ominously, a threat that any US showing of the comedy film that culminates in the assassination of Kim, could produce another 9/11 type attack
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The threat was issued on December 16 by an outfit calling itself, the "Guardians of Peace"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which also claims to have been behind the hack attack on Sony
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It promised a "Christmas gift" for the American people
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Within 48 hours of the threat, and following pleas by companies owning most of the cinemas in the US, as well as by the shopping centres in which the cinemas are situated, Sony pulled the film
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which is quite a coup for whoever orchestrated the assault on the company
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The original hack cost Sony an estimated $170m
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: withdrawing the film will cost the company another $45m
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it cost to make plus whatever the film would have taken in at theatres and from home release
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a big deal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is worth noting that it is not 100 percent positive that Pyongyang is behind the Sony hack or the 9/11 warning
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes, the FBI asserts (with its customary assurance) that North Korea is guilty on both counts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: leading cyber security experts say (with equal certitude) that the evidence of North Korean responsibility is sketchy at best
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: As for the North Korean regime itself, it flatly denies any involvement while at the same time issuing threats against the US that are even more blood curdling than the one issued by the "Guardians of Peace"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: (who may or may not be the North Koreans themselves)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whoever the culprits are, they did not inflict major damage on the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Contrary to those who are screaming that by pulling the film, the US surrendered the concept of freedom of speech
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is not the US government that pulled the film
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Obama said that if Sony had talked to him first, he would have told the company to show the film as planned
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But Sony did not talk to Obama
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because its decision to withdraw the film had nothing to do with the US or its national interests but with the financial interests of the multinational corporation itself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Multinationals do not, for reasons implied in the very term multinational, act with an eye on any flag
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These are businesses
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: profit, not patriotism, is their guide
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is, therefore, ridiculous to accuse the US of yielding to the threat of a foreign dictator
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It didn't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sony did
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: from the point of view of its shareholders, it probably did the right thing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Losing $45m in production costs for "The Interview" is nothing compared to Sony's potential liability
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: some catastrophe occurred at a showing of the film in Los Angeles or Washington, DC
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is not to say that there are no foreign policy implications of this debacle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sony's decision to make a comedy about the assassination of the North Korean head of state was a terrible idea that has only worsened the US' already terrible relations with this very unstable nuclear-armed nation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: reports that a State Department official read the script and approved of the assassination scenario are true
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that is troubling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Driving an already unbalanced head of state off the deep end is clearly not something diplomats should sign off on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: certain elements in the US government want to see an increase in tensions with North Korea, and maybe even an attempt at "regime change"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Although Obama was careful to say that North Korea's purported actions constituted "cyber vandalism" but "not an act of war"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Senator John McCain, who becomes chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee next month, said on Friday that it is indeed an act of war to which the US must respond
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Former speaker of the House Newt Gingrich agrees
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: as do eager warriors in both political parties, those who promoted war with Iraq and now oppose a nuclear deal with Iran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Those two countries are, of course, charter members of former President George W Bush's original "Axis of Evil" regimes that he and his allies wanted eliminated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The third member was North Korea
paragraphs.label: assumption
